c74object.name: th.gl.texteditor
c74object.digest: Create a texteditor for the rendering context
c74object.description: A basic code text-editor for the opengl world of Max. Add the object to your setup and initialize it with the name of the render context. Make sure you send it the render bang in the top inlet. The outlet outputs the parsed text as a list of symbols that you can use in any way you like. For example control parameters of gl objects, control musical parameters, lighting shows, just use it as a typewriter or whatever you think of!

objarg.name: rendering-context
objarg.digest: The named drawing context in which to draw (default = none).
objarg.description: Set the name of the rendering context. This is the name given to the jit.world, jit.gl.render or jit.gl.node object.

method.name: bang
method.description: Input a continuous stream of bangs so parameters stay up to date per frame.

method.name: run
method.digest: Output the current textbuffer as a list of symbols per line.
method.description: Output the current textbuffer as a list of symbols per line.

method.name: write
method.digest: Write the textbuffer to a disk file.
method.description: Write the textbuffer to a disk file. Additional filepath + filename sets the destination to store to.

method.name: read
method.digest: Read the a textfile from disk.
method.description: Read the a textfile from disk.

attribute.name: drawto
attribute.digest: The named drawing context in which to draw (default = none).
attribute.description: The named drawing context in which to draw (default = none). A named drawing context is a named instace of a jit.window, jit.pwindow, or jit.matrix object taht ahas an instance of the jit.gl.render object associated with it.

attribute.name: output_matrix
attribute.digest: Output the text as a matrix (default = 0).
attribute.description: Output the text as a matrix instead of the list of symbols per line of text (default = 0).

attribute.name: font
attribute.digest: Set the font for the editor (default = Courier New Bold).
attribute.description: Set the font for the editor (default = Courier New Bold). This must be a mono-spaced font otherwise the cursor won't align properly.

attribute.name: cursor
attribute.digest: Change the characters for the cursor (default = "<<").
attribute.description: Change the characters for the cursor (default = "<<").

attribute.name: comment
attribute.digest: Change the characters for commenting text (default = //)
attribute.description: Change the characters for commenting text (default = //).

attribute.name: run_color
attribute.digest: Set the color for blinking when the code is executed.
attribute.description: Set the color for blinking when the code is executed.

attribute.name: cursor_color
attribute.digest: Set the color for the cursor.
attribute.description: Set the color for the cursor.

attribute.name: number_color
attribute.digest: Set the color for the line numbers.
attribute.description: Set the color for the line numbers.

attribute.name: blink_color
attribute.digest: Set the blink color for the cursor.
attribute.description: Set the blink color for the cursor. This is the secundary color visible when blinking is enabled.

attribute.name: enable_blink
attribute.digest: Enable the blink color of the cursor (default = 1).
attribute.description: Enable the blinking of the cursor. This will alternate between the cursor_color and the blink_color (default = 1).

attribute.name: scale
attribute.digest: The relative scale for the entire text (default = 1).
attribute.description: The relative scale for the entire text (default = 1).

attribute.name: position
attribute.digest: The relative position of the text (default = 0 0)
attribute.description: The relative position of the text (default = 0 0)
